reviewText: When you watch wrestling you have to differentiate between fantasy and reality, and 99.9% of the time it's all fake, but in this instance between Bret Hart and Vince McMahon it is not.....after watching this tape i lost all respect i had for McMahon....Bret Hart is a legend and probably the greatest wrestler ever (Shawn Michaels does not deserve to be in the same ring)..........but not everything goes right for the true fans.Besides this it is an excellent tape....the main event is lovely until the ending and the undercard is awesome. There was an excellent buildup and i'd say best Survivor Series ever besides 1990s.
summary: It's a fantastic pay per view but what a shame..........
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: This event was the most talked about WWF Pay Per View in the history of sports entertainment.  With the WWF Championship on the line, Champion-Bret Hart defends against WWF European Champion-Shawn Michaels.  Keep your eyes  on Vince McMahon.  The WWF Intercontinental Title goes on the line when  Champion-the late great Owen Hart defends against Stone Cold Steve Austin.  Kane vs. Mankind in a awesome but brutal encounter.  Plus the traditional  Survivor Series elimination tag matches which include stars like the Rock,  Ken Shamrock, New Age Outlaws, British Bulldog, Vader, and many others.
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: This to me is one of the greatest survivor series of all time plus theres alot of good matches.
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: Ok guys, we know what happened. This space is for reviews on the product, and not any bitching and stuff that you guys dont like. Maybe instead of focusing on the montreal screw job, some of you could talk a little about the Kane vs. Mankind match. The fact that the Kane character was fresh at the time, as well as interesting, makes for a must see match by me.
summary: Enough of the Montreal Screw Job
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: I am reviewing a show that I don't want to really talk about but I will since I am reviewing old WWF Pay Per Views. It's great if you decide to read this & care about what my opinion is on subject that has been talked about to death The Montreal Screwjob. So I am sure you found this review randomly or you grew up during this time period of Professional Wrestling like me. Or you never got to experience this time peroid & are just interested in the past. Now I will try to explain my best what lead up to the mess in Montreal. 1st things 1st this is an all heel program involving Bret Hart who was a heel Shawn Michaels who was heel at the time & they didn't get along in real life & it also includes McMahon. So there are no babyfaces. Now how HBK, Bret & Vince McMahon got to this point you'll have to go back to Wrestlemania XII when Shawn Michaels beat Bret Hart for the title & he told Bret to get the F out of the ring Bret's actions backstage where he was mad was suppose to make the fans believe that they hated each other & maybe the boys in the locker room too. Bret took off time from April to November his contract was up & if you grew up around this time WCW was taking a lot of WWF stars cause the boss Eric Bischoff had Ted Turner's money to throw around. Hulk Hogan joined in 1994 after we all thought that he was done with wrestling. In 1996 Diesel & Razor Ramon left to go to WCW & form The NWO with Hulk Hogan. Roddy Piper also went to WCW in 1996. WCW wanted Bret Hart so they offered him a big contract I don't know how much it was but Vince came back with an offer for a 20 year contract which made Bret the highest paid wrestler in the business surpasing Hogan, Nash, Sting, Hall & Flair money in WCW. Hart came back to The WWF faced Stone Cold Steve Austin at the 1996 Survivor Series where he won but he put Austin over. Then they wanted to build up to Mania where Shawn Michaels accidently cost Bret Hart the title at IYH 12 & they had confrontations in December of 1996 Shawn regained the title at the 1997 Royal Rumble in his hometown. They were setting the stage for Wrestlemania 13 plus you had the conterversal ending to The Royal Rumble match where they had the remaining 4 wrestlers from The Royal Rumble face each other in a Fatal 4 Way Match. Shawn Michaels forfitted The WWF Championship due to a knee injury. Bret Hart said that he thinks he lied about it cause he says that Shawn was suppose to drop the title to him at Wrestlemania 13. This is at the point were life imitated art. Bret Hart had another 5 star classic with Stone Cold Steve Austin at Wrestlemania 13. Bret turned heel reunbited with his Brother Owen & Brother In Law The British Bulldog. Jim Neidhart & Brian Pillman would later join. TV was improving in the spring & by the summer I thought TV was better than WCW. In May of 1997 Bret talked to Shawn & told him to trust him cause it will lead to something great down the road. They had an in ring confrontation where Bret was just verbally owning Shawn Michaels & the show went off the air while Bret was in mid sentance & the part where Bret tells Shawn he doesn't have the insides to hit him & Shawn Michaels Superkicks him never made air. When he was told that his Superkick never made air he was angry & blamed Bret. Bret & Shawn got in a  real life fight on June 9th before an episode of RAW IS WAR Hart told Shawn that they were going to be the main event of Wrestlemaina XIV in Boston & Bret will be the champion going in. Bret toled Shawn I have no problem putting you over. Shawn said I appreciate that but I wouldn't do the same for you. They got in a fight in The Timeline 1997 DVD Jim Cornette tells how Bret ripped a piece of Shawn's hair out. Shawn basically wanted out of The WWF to go to WCW cause he had a lot of heat in the lockeroom. Well McMahon convinced him to stay. So at Summerslam Shawn was The Special Guest Referee he cost Undertaer the match allowing Bret Hart to win The WWF title. Michaels went on to work a great program with The Undertaker including the perfectly booked 5 star He l l In A Cell Match. On September 22nd Vince McMahon told Bret Hart I cannot afford your contract so try & renegotate your deal with WCW. Bret still had The WWF Championship & he found out his last match would be near the end of the year or early 1998. Vince wanted Bret to drop the title to Shawn. Bret said he wouldn't drop it to Shawn cause Shawn said he would never drop the title to him. Vince went & got Shawn so he could repeat that story in front of Shawn but McMahon told HBK right in front of Bret that were putting the belt back on you. Bret sid he felt betrayed. Now there are conflicting stories on why Bret didn't want to drop the title 1 of the most popular is he felt he was a national sports hero in Canada. Bret has said that he told Vince McMahon that he would forfit the title the next night on RAW IS WAR or at the next In Your House Pay Per View. Bischoff has said that he wanted Bret to finish business & come to WCW with a clean slate. On The Timeline 1997 DVD Jim Cornette said why should Vince trust Eric Bishcofff cause he has the personality of a used car salesman. I agree. A few days before The Pay per View Vince had a conferance call with Shawn Michaels & Triple H. He told them that Bret didn't want to drop the title on Sunday. On The Heatbreak & Triumph DVD Triple H said supposedly said that if he won't do business you need to business for him. Yeah HHH took responsiblity for the screwjob. Vince told them not to say anything he will take the heat. The reason for this was 2 years prior Madusa was The WWF Woman's Champion & Vince had abolished The Woman's division Madusa still had the belt & she showed up on Nitro & threw the belt in the trash can. There was a meeting the night before in a Hotel in Montreal with McMahon, Seargent Slughter, Gerald Brisco & Jim Cornette. Cornette mentions on The Timeline 1997 DVD that Bret was asked to drop the title on November The 7th in at a House Show Bret refused casue it was in Toranto Canada. Then he was asked well how anbout Detroit the next night Bret still refused that cause they were selling Survivor Series on me being the champion & he didn't want to let his Canadian Fans down.Cornette let Vince know if you let Bret hand you the title & let him go to WCW to make all that money you might as well let him pi s s in you mouth. Cornette also mentions that in October when Bret was in a match with Ken Shamrock he said that Ken Shamrock would have no problem beating up Bret Hart for real & just double cross him. Cornette also said that the double cross wasn't Vince Russo's idea. Around the late afternoon early evening of the event Shawn Michaels described it as an eerie day Bret showed up late he stayed behind closed  doors. 1 guy wasn't involved in any of this was Pat Patterson he was close to Bret like a Father & Son or Brothers or like a Boyfriend lol. I kid I kid. Patterson came up with this idea where Shawn would put Bret in The Sharpshooter. After the conversation Shawn went to find Vince McMahon he told him I'll put him in The Sharpshooter & Earl Hebner The Senior Referee will order the bell to be rung. He told Earl Hebner what he needed to do & don't tell anyone. On The Bret vs Shawn DVD Bret said that he hoped that Earl Hebner was The Referee for the match casue he could trust him. That is the best way I can explain this mess.Now I will go into the actual storylines going into this Pay Per View. On The October 6th episode of RAW IS WAR Bret Hart & Shawn Michaels had a confrontation Bret said that he didn't understand how Shawn was in the main event of another Pay Per View when he is the higest paid wrestler in the business & he is the champion. He added that he was the 1 that ran Diesel & Razor Ramon off. Shawn Michaels resopnded by telling Bret to s u c k it & he shouldn't confuse expansion & destruction. Later on that night Shawn Michaels caused Bret Hart to lose to Triple H by countout. The next week DeGeneration X started a war with The Hart Foundation & The Nation Of Domination. The next week on RAW IS WAR DX set The Hart Foundation up as racists. The Nation Of Domination wanted a piece of The Hart Foundation the following week on RAW IS WAR The Nation Of Domination called The Hart Foundation while Bret was explaining the situation DX appeared on The Titan Tron & caused more problems & a fight broke out on stage with The Hart Foundation & The Nation Of Domination. Later that night Bret defended The WWF Championship against Ken Shamrock Shawn Michaels interfered & they got in a fight where they had to be pulled apart. Bret cut a serious promo while Shawn Michaels response was to moon a camera. On The October 3rd episode of RAW IS WAR Stone Cold Steve Austin agreed to the deal for him to retrun if he got hurt The World Wrestling Federation wouldn't be held responsible. Plus he got a grudge match with Owen Hart at The Survivor Series for The Intercontinental Championship. To keep his shot for The IC title Austin interfered in everyone of Owen Hart's title defenses. Austin made enemies with The Nation Of Domination. On The October 27th episode of RAW IS WAR Austin gave Ahmed Johnson a Stone Cold Stunner when Ahmed almost had won The Intercontinental title. Ahmed cut a promo on Austin at the end of the show he said "You've lost her 3 fixed tees . Watch you did by pudding Hanson meat was entered The Zone Mike Zone. See Mike Zone is Cadillac Enzo once ya end there it's Gore. You just Gored on me. Nelly's Mike Tern to Gore on you. So next Mundane night look celt KAAAAAAM! Devin The Dead Cow! The following week on RAW IS WAR Vince McMahon interviewed Stone Cold Steve Austin Ahmed came out & challenged Austin to a match. He said it in that special Ahmed Johnson way " Is anyone Steve Austin? I bit ya last week Howie respected you! I'm at the last week you had my respect. But last week you crushed my ENZO. Now I can PROMISH you Steve Austin I'm going to kick your A S S!!! If it's the lass thing I do her. YEAH If you know your vans out here> Roycee I don't habba habba vans. ON MY LIFE!!! DIRT TEEN!!! DIRT TEEN YOU'RE LOW!!! I BIT ON MY OWN!!! FOR MY OWN THING!!! RATED MYSELF!!! I wanna jam with me YOU!! ARE YOU GONE BACKSTAB ME LIKE TEX??? ABDAH RESPECTED YOU!!! TODAY WATER CHEW IN EYE Puddhar Geerahn come out here punk AND GET IT ON! Let's do it BURN ALL YOUR STUFF. Today not the mall. Their showdown didn't happen cause when Ahmed was waiting in the ring for Austin Kane came out & attacked Ahmed. On The October 20th episode of RAW IS WAR The Undertaker said he will not fight his brother Kane cause he promised his dead parents he would never fight a family member. So Kane attacked Dude Love & chokeslammed him 2 times on the ramp. Foley then went into Mankind mode & challenged Kane at The Survivor Series. The following week on RAW IS WAR Mankind was told by Seargent Slaughter that he wouldn't let the match take place cause Mankind is crazy & he didn't know what Kane was. Mankind put Seargent Slaughter in a Mandible Claw & then he made the match. On The October 13th episode of RAW IS WAR The Road Warriors defeated The Godwins to win The WWF Tag Team Championship. Meanwhile Jesse James talked to The Rockabilly who was The Honky Tonk Man's protoge. He told him that we should form a tag team. Rockabilly hit Honky Tonk Man with a guitar & The New Age Outlaws were formed. On The November 3rd episode of RAW IS WAR Jim Ross interviewed Dustin Rhodes & Marlena. Dustin told Marlena off & broke their marriage off & told her that he found someone that understands him. On The October 3rd episode of RAW IS WAR after Vader won a Dog Collar Match against The British Bulldog he was attacked by The Bulldog, Jim "The Anvil" Neidhart & Doug Furnas & Phillip LaFon. Steve Blackman as a fan debuted & fought the heels off. On The October 20th episode of RAW IS WAR Jeff Jarrett returned to The WWF for those of you that care. That is pretty much the backstory going into this event. The buyrate was a 0.89 that is up from Survivor Series 1996 that got a 0.60.The current champions at the time wereWWF Champion Bret Hart August 3rd 1997WWF Intercontinental Champion Owen Hart October 5th 1997WWF European Champion Shawn Michaels September 20th 1997WWF Tag Team Champions The Road Warriors Hawk & Animal October 7th 1997 match aired October 13th 1997Date November 9, 1997Attendance 20,593Venue Molson CentreFree For AllThere was a very good opening.They showed comments by the fans who they thought would win between Bret Hart & Shawn Michaels 1 fan said it doesn't matter cause they'll both go down when Austin gets a shot at The WWF title. No suprise the fans are solidly behind Bret.They show a great video package for The Bret Hart Shawn Michaels match. 15 plus years later I still feel the same drama & tension about this match. Dok Hendrix interviewed Triple H & Chyna. Triple H said that it's truth or dare time he told Bret you bring what you got & will bring what we got.TV spot for a Stone Cold T shirt was shown.A spot called Attitiude is shown although I don't know why Bret is in it when he didn't get to take part in The Attitude Era.They show what lead up to Kane debuting & his recent attacks on random wrestlers & why Kane will face Mankind tonight.Michael Cole interviewed Paul Bearer he said Kane cannot be stopped but he invited Mankind to die trying. Paul Bearer gave an evil laugh as he walked off.Dok Hendrix asks Jim Ross & Jerry Lawler who they think will win The Bret Hart Shawn Michaels match. JR said the home field advantage will be hard for Shawn Michaels to overcome. The King thinks both DeGeneration X & The Hart Foundation will interfere in the match.Then we get to The Pay Per View & it's an awesome opening.Survivor Series Elimination MatchThe New Age OutlawsRoad Dogg & BA Billy Gunn& The Godwins Henry & PhenneasDefThe New BlackjacksWinham & Bradshaw& The HeadbangersMosh & ThrasherBradshaw eliminated Henry GodwinPhinneas eliminated Barry WindhamBilly Gunn eliminated MoshThrasher eliminated Phinneas GodwinRoad Dogg eliminated BradshawBilly Gunn eliminated Thrasher ** & a half of a starThe New Age Outlaws were the survivorsSurvivor Series Elimination matchThe Truth CommissionReconSniperThe Interrgator& The JackylDefThe DOACrushChainzSkull& 8 BallThe Interrgator eliminated Chainz8 Ball eliminated The Jackyl then Jackyl joined JR & The King on commentary which he was funnySkull eliminated ReconSniper eliminated 8 BallThe Interrgator eliminated SkullCrush eliminated SniperThe Interrgator eliminated Crush * & a half of a star a mediocore matchThey show more footage with the fans giving their predictions on who will win The Shawn Michaels Bret Hart match.kevin Kelly interviewed Stone Cold who as in The A O L Room Austin said he is concerened about his neck but that it's something that happens & I don't need anyone feeling sorry for me.Michael Cole interviewed Team USA Vader said we don't have a lot in common but we don't like big mouth Canadians. Steve Blackman said I am nervous but a fight is a fightSurvivor Series Elimination MatchTeam CanadaBritish BulldogJim "The Anvil" Neidhart& Doug Furnas & Phillip LaFonDefTeam USABig Van VaderSteve BlackmanMarc Mero& GoldustTeam USA used the theme that Kurt Angle would use. Team Canada used Bret Hart's theme.Steve Blackman was counted outVader eliminated Jim NeidhartVader eliminated Phillip LaFonDoug Furnas eliminated Marc Mero which made me happyGoldust got himself counted out cause he refused to competeVader eliminated Doug FurnasBritish Bulldog eliminated Big Van Vader *** & quarter of a starJR & The King talk to the winner of The Survivor Series Super Supper Sweepstakes & she wants to have Austin over for dinner.A featurette is shown on KaneKane with Paul Bearer Def Mankind ** & a half of a starThis match was a brawl but it was decent Mankind took a sick bump off of the ring apron down to The Spanish Announcers Table. I think Mick Foley is a good guy cause he put people over & made them look good even if he wins or loses he put people over & this being Glen Jacobs 1st match as The Kane character after putting up with that awful Issic Yankem gimmick looked like a real threat.Michael Cole interviewed Seargent Sluaghter & Vince McMahon who said they have extra security cause there has to be a winner & it's important for the fans to finally see The Rematch. Cole asked McMahon who he thinks will win. He said he doesn't know. Yeah you do cause you & Shawn Michaels decided to do business for him.Survivor Series Elimination MatchKen ShamrockThe Road WarriorsHawk & Animal& Ahmed JohnsonDefThe Nation Of DominationFaarooqRocky MiaviaD'Lo Brown& Kama MoustphaRocky Miavia eliminated HawkAhmed Johnson eliminated FaarooqRocky Miavia eliminated Ahmed JohnsonAnimal eliminated Kama MoustphaAnimal was counted outKen Shamrock eliminated D'Lo BrownKen Shamrock eliminated Rocky Miavia *** Shamrock was the only survivorMichael Cole talks to the fans & asks who they think is going to win between Bret & Shawn.Ad shown for The DeGeneration X In Your House PPV with The DX playing.An excellent video package for The Austin vs Owen Hart match is shown.Grudge Match for TheWWF Intercontinental ChampionshipStone Cold Steve Austin Def Champion Owen Hart with British Bulldog Jim "The Anvil" Neidart & Doug Furnas & Phillip LaFon *Austin a good enterance this match though was poor & a let down from that great match from Summerslam but Austin had just came back from a neck injury so they needed to see how he would do. BTW Austin owned Furnas & LaFon after the match.An amazing video package is shown for The Hart Michaels matchTHE REMATCHWWF ChampionshipShawn Michaels Def Champion Bret Hart when Vince McMahon ordered the bell to be rung while Shawn Michaels had Bret Hart in The Sharpshooter Bret didn't tap*** & 3 quarters of a star 5+ for historical purposesThe part where the cameras followed Bret Hart & Shawn Michaels in the back to the enterance gave a feeling that The New Generation Era was in it's dying days & that the product was going more twords attitude. After the match the fans were beyond angry Bret Hart lost it & broke monitiors which I always laugh at. There was big time fall out 1 thing that happend was The WWF got back to being the number 1 company that they were in the 80's & early 90's. Cause Steve Austin would dominate 1998 & Rocky Miavia became The Rock becoming a big star. The young talent in WCW who were never used right cause they favored old past their prime wrestlers for the most part the young talent would go to The WWF. Bret Hart was totally misused in WCW from Starrcade 1997 to when he retired in 2000. Vince told Bret they won't know how to use you & it will drive you nuts because as we all know Eric Bischoff has the personality of a used car salesman to me. There was fall out with the lockeroom like Mick Foley wanted to leave but eventually stayed. Rick Rude who was on some kind of handshake deal or whatever went to WCW which he was on RAW & Nitro at the same time. Owen was going to leave but ended up staying. British Bulldog & Jim Neidhart would go to WCW they were misused too. Bulldog would show up 2 years later in The WWF he would have a forgettable run. Bret would return in 2010 & they finally buried the hatchet. So I hope you understand why things happened the way they did.As a bonus I'm going to review WWF DeGeneration X In Your House this show was never released in The US & I can see why. This was the last Pay Per View The WWF had in 1997 & if you've followed me you know 1997 was an intense year & it was make or break cause 1995 was p i s s poor 1996 was hit or miss the start of 1997 was hit & miss with The Royal Rumble having a great live gate but a PPV buys were in the neighborhood of 280,000 maybe less & it was a dome stadium that needed a show instead of a show that needed a big dome stadium. Plus Shawn Michaels forfitting the title Wrestlemania 13 was a weak event except for 1 match & The Undetaker finally getting the belt back. The Spring produced better TV & Stone Cold Steve Austin was over with the crowd as a fan favorite. The Summer of 97 The TV was better than what WCW was putting out imo. The 3 Pay Per Views King Of The Ring, Canadian Stampede & Summerslam were all good to amazing you can read my reviews for those shows if you like. Bret Hart & The Hart Foundation along with the formation of DeGeneration X were big hits. Bret Hart being sc r ewed over & losing The WWF title for real I mean I could go on & on about how great the recovery for The WWF was in 1997 but that would take up too much time. so how did The WWF close 1997 with a whimper or a bang. There are few noteworthy events that took place on The November 10th episode of RAW IS WAR Ken Shamrock challenged Shawn Michaels for The WWF Championship Seargent Slaughter made the match for DX In Your House. While Triple H was wrestling Ken Shamrock Seargent Slaughter did everything he could to stop DX from interfering. Shawn Michaels was in the ring & Seargent Slaughter bumped Shawn Michaels into Ken Shamrock he rolled Michaels up Seargent Slaughter counted the pinfall. The following week on RAW IS WAR Shawn Michaels pointed out that Ken Shamrock was friends with Bret Hart he said that DeGeneration X will destroy anyone associated with The Hart's. Triple H got personal with Seargent Slaughter who made referance's to having s 3 x with Slaughter's wife Seargent Slaughter got in a fight with Triple H but was beaten down by Michaels & Chyna. Then Seargen Slaughter announced tha the is returning to the ring to face Triple H at DeGeneration X In Your House. Seargent Slaughter decided the following week on RAW IS WAR to use his powers as Commissoner to make it a Boot Camp Match. The next week on RAW IS WAR Triple H had a match with Jim Neidhart DX beat him down they took spray paint & spray painted WCW on Neidhart's back they handcuffed Neidhart to the ropes this brought out Seargent Slaughter who was triple teamed then Ken Shamrock came out & put Shawn in the ankle lock while Seargent Slaughter had Triple H in The Cobra Clutch. On The November 10th episode of RAW IS WAR Rocky maivia who was now going by The Rock challenged Stone Cold Steve Austin for The Intercontinental title. Austin's response was for Rocky to get a decent haircut & flush himself down a commode. The following week on RAW IS WAR Austin was in an altercation with The Nation Of Domination The Rock stole the Intercontinental title belt. The follwoing week on RAW IS WAR Stone Cold took over the control room where he had Rocky s u ck s flash on The Titan Tron. The Rock sent The Nation Of Domination to the back Stone Cold appeared on The Titan Tron he told The Rock to check his paiger to look if it says 3 1 6 & it did The Rock's eyes look like they were going to pop out. Austin was right behind him & beat The Rock up. The next week on RAW IS WAR while The Rock was wrestling Vader Stone Cold started 1 of his trademarks where he drove his truck into the area. Not much to say it was a funny. On The November 24th episode of RAW IS WAR The New Age Outlaws defeated The Road Warriors to win The WWF Tag Team Championship. Jeff Jarrett refused to wrestle on The November 24th & December 1st episodes of RAW IS WAR Seargent Slaughter told him he will wrestle at DX In Your House & face The Undertaker. There was a tournatment to decide the 1st WWF Lightheavyweight Champion Taka Michinoku & Brian Christopher made it to the finals. On The November 10th episode of RAW IS WAR Michael Cole interviewed Butterbean Marc Mero who had became jelous of as late told Michael Cole to interview a real Boxer. He accused Butterbean of stalking his Wife Sable who he called his property. The next week on RAW IS WAR Butterbean was there again Mero was mad which set up a 4 Round Boxing Match at this show. On a little side note Goldust hit Vader with a hammer on The November 17th episode of RAW IS WAR & refused to wrestle him. The next week on RAW IS WAR Goldust came out in a wheelchair he had a nurse with him that sprayed rubbing alchol into Vader's eyes the nurse reviled herself to be Luna Vachon. The next week on RAW IS WAR Luna introduced us to The Artist Formally Known As Goldust. That is all of the backstory going into this show. The buyrate was an 0.44 which is in the area of 176,000 buys. Up from It's Time's buyrayte of 0.35. This shows buyrate is an understandable drop off from Survivor Series that got a 0.89.The current champions in The WWF at the time wereWWF Champion Shawn Michaels November 9th 1997WWF Intercontinental Champion Stone Cold Steve Austin November 9th 1997WWF European Champion Shawn Michaels September 20th 1997WWF Tag Team Champions The New Age Outlaws Jesse James & Billy Gunn November 24th 1997Date December 7, 1997Attendance 6,358Venue Springfield Civic CenterCity Springfield, MassachusettsFree For AllA pretty good video package is shown for The Stone Cold vs Rock Intercontinental title match.The Rock was interviewed by Jim Cornette he said that he is The People's Champion & the best d am n Intercontinental Champion there ever was.A very average video package is shown on Ken Shamrock. Some of DX's antics from RAW were shown.Jeff Jarrett cut a promo he said the fans will have the honor & plesure to watch me wrestle. He was inturrpeted by The Undertaker who said over The PA System it will be a shame that a star will crash to the ground he told Double J welcome back to The WWF & he has such sights to show him.The we get to The Pay Per View there is a mediocore opening.Finals to decide the 1stWWF Lightheavyweight ChampionTaka Michinoku Def Brian Christopher ** to win the title. Brian Christopher got Jerry's Kid chants. Lawler helped his son with his busted lip which made me smie. Brian Christopher was bleeding from the bottom lip like a water hose even though it probably wasn't real blood. Jerry Lawler's reaction to Taka Michinoku winning was priceless. This is the best it's going to be until the main event.6 Man Tag Team MatchLos BoricusMiguel Perez JrJose Estrada& Jeus CastilloDefThe DOAChainzSkull& 8 Ball * a poor matchSavio Vega was sent ot the back & Crush wasn't at this show cause he was injured by Kane 2 weeks earlier. BTW I am sick of DOA & Los Boricus matches.Dok Hendrix interviewed Butterbean who is ready for Marc Mero cause of the way he treats Sable. Michael Cole interviewed Sable she was at a Butterbean fight the night beforeA ok video package for The Mero Butterbean match was shown.Mero inturrpeted Sable's interview he said for her to stealing his spotlight.4 Round Boxing MachButterbean Def Marc Mero with Sable by disqualification DUDButterbean had some hilarously bac music. I saw a sign that said who booked this yeah I would like to know too. Cause these Boxing Matches in Pro Wrestling never really worked. It didn't work in the 80's it didn't work in The 90's & I doubt it would work now. This would not be the last we would see of Butterbean he would compete in Wrestlemania XV & bury Bart Gunn.In the back Mick Foley is in The A O L Room who said he & Stone Cold are soul mates.Luna & The Artist Formally Known As Goldust came out The Artist wanted to share a story. He read us some Dr Seuss which was read better than anybody who ever told me the story as a kid.WWF Tag Team ChampionshipChampions The New Age Outlaws Road Dogg Jesse James & BA Billy GunnDEF The Road Warriors Hawk & Animal by disqualification * another poor match Henry Godwin interfered Hawk took the bucket from Henry Godwin hit both Outlaws with it & they were disqualified.A bad ad is shown for WWF The Music Volume 2.A terible video package is shown for The Boot Camp matchMichael Cole interviewed Triple H he said he has a survival kit for Seargen Slaughter he said there will be no hard feelings after the match in fact he might drop by Slaughter's house to let his wife smoke the peace pipe.Boot Camp MatchTriple H Def Seargent Slaughter & * a quarter of a starSeargent Slughter came out with the music that would be used by an American Hero 2 years later so you go figure. This match went on to long & could've been cut by 5 or 6 minutes. Slaughter was way past his prime this match could've easially been placed on RAW. Slaughter did a few botches I have to wonder did this Pay Per View make botchamania. A way below average match.Ad shown for The Royal Rumble & it's the same ad from the last 2 years.Michael Cole interviewed Jeff Jarrett who said tonight is when the cream rises to the top.Jeff Jarrett Def Undertaker by disqualification * & quarter of a starthe 3rd DQ of the night Kane came out Jarrett told Kane to take care of The Undertaker for him Kane chokeslammed him he hit The Undertaker he did nothing in respose. Jeff Jarrett attacked The Undertaker & went for The Figure 4 but was chokeslammed by The Undertaker. I don't know why this was on The Pay Per View other than angle advancement for Kane & The Undertaker.Micael Cole interviewed Mark Henry who was in a Sky Box he said he is coming back after being out with an injury for a year & half if you follow my reviews in the future then get used to Henry being injured.Dok Hendrix interviewed The RockWWF Intercontinental ChampionshipChampion Stone Cold Steve Austin Def The Rock with The Nation Of Domination * & half starsThe Rock got plenty of Rocky s u c ks chants when Austin drove his truck into the arena the fans nearly blew the roof off the arena. Austin gave D'Lo Brown a stunner on his truck. Kama accidently hit Faarooq with a chair & Austin threw Kama into the truck. A average match but it was better than the rest of the under card.That average video package for Ken Shamrock was shownWWF ChampionshipKen Shamrock Def Champion Shawn Michaels with Triple H & Chynaby disqualification ** & 3 quarters of a star near 3 stars it could've been better & having the 4th DQ of the night didn't help either. I think it should've been better case Michaels is a great wrestler & Shamrock is legit. There style didn't mix or it's cause Shamrock was mad about what happened to Bret & didn't work hard. The highlight was when Owen Hart jumped Shawn Midhaels out of nowhere & beat the c r ap out of him.This show was lame very lame. Not the worst PPV I've seen but it's up there with IYH 9 & Great American Bash 91. There are better Pay Per Views from 1997 than this show Canadian Stamped & Summerslam come to mind 1st The WWF ended 1997 on a moan & whimper not a bang considering how enjoyable the year was late March to the end mainly plus 1998 was even better. DX In Your House had a really bad undercard the onener was ok & the main event was near 3 stars if you need to see this show see it on You Tube or get it off a seller that sells DVDR's of these old shows. BTW the good old days weren't always good.
summary: The only time someone loses the title for real 8/10 bonus DeGeneration X In Your House review & rant 4/10
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: All the Survivor Series elimination tag team matches were not great but pretty good. The Kane-Mankind match was a solid & hard-hitting brawl. The IC title match between Steve Austin & Owen Hart was short but sweet. The world title match between Bret Hart & HBK while not a bad match,it will only be remember for the infamous doublecross and nothing else. I give this PPV a 7 out of 10.
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: When a wrestling fan hears the words "Survivor Series 1997", one name springs to mind: Bret Hart.If you are any wrestling fan worth your salt, you need to own this videotape.  The undercard features the  traditional Survivor Series format matches, which, although quite  predictable, helped to keep the pro-Canadian crowd happy.  Kane solidified  his position of the most imposing force since the in-ring debut of his  "brother" The Undertaker, at the same event seven years previous.  Owen Hart and Stone Cold Steve Austin provided a short, yet highly  emotional match, when both could have called a sicky (Owen had a brain  bruise, thanks to Ahmed Johnson, and Austin was getting over having his  neck broken three months before at SummerSlam, another ace PPV).But this  event will be remembered for the treatment of one Bret "Hit Man"  Hart, the canadian hero, screwed in his own country by a paranoid Vince  McMahon.  You won't pick this information up for the propagandic commentary  of Jim Ross, but if you watch "Hitman Hart: Wrestling With  Shadows", you'll have a better idea on Bret's thoughts before, during  and after this match, the most controvercial match in wrestling ever, and  one that will be talked about for years to come.
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: I haven't seen the ppv but the 1997 story is confusing unless you know it. Bret is the greatest and I can never forgive vince for what he did.

reviewText: Overall this was an excellent event for the exception of the extreamly upsetting ending to the main event. Here are the matches.1. Road Dogg, Billy Gunn, Phinneas Godwinn, and Henry Godwinn VS. Headbanger Mosh, Headbanger Thrasher, Bradshaw, and Barry Windham 7/10Good opening match, but it went a lttle too slow.2. Kurrgan, Recon, Sniper, and The Jackel VS. Crush, 8-Ball, Skull, and Chainz 6/10This was not as good as I thought it was going to be becausewas too short and the same person kept on doing the eliminations.3. Vader, Marc Mero, Steve Blackman, and Goldust VS. British Bulldog, Jim The Anvil Neidhart, Doug Furnas, and Phil LaFon 10/10This was one the best matches of the night. I truly think this was a good classic Survivor Series match. All wrestlers did their best except for Goldust who never wrestled and just stood there. Just a good match!4. Mankind VS. Kane 8/10This match was not as good as I expected. Although Mankind made many valiant efforts such as when he tripped over the stairs and the railing, chokeslammed or pushed through a table, and slammed to the hard floor.5. Faarooq, The Rock, D-Lo Brown, and Kama VS. Ken Shamrock, Ahmed Johnson, Animal, and Hawk 8/10Good match but I would have been happier if Shamrock's entire team survived.6. Stone Cold Steve Austin VS. Owen Hart 7/10A REALLY short match. There is nothing much to describe here other than Owen Hart's t-shirt was funny, and that Steve Austin stunned Owen to win the Intercontinental Title.7. Shawn Michaels VS. Bret The Hitman Hart 10/10 or 0/10I really do not know what to rate this because it was a good fight but Bret Hart was also stolen from the title. It took a while for this match to start because when they both got to the ring, they fought outside and then they went to the ring. All was going well until Shawn Michaels put Bret Hart in a sharpshooter and Vince McMahon made the referee and the bell man to ring the bell when Bret did not tap. After that Shawn Michaels left with the title really fast and then Bret Hart just went really CRAZY and broke everthing at ringside.
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: A GOOD ENDING FOR THE 1992 MAIN EVENT WITH SHAWN MICHAELS SUB TO BRET HARTS HOLD.ANY WAY NO SREW JOBS OR SPITTING IN PEOPLES FACES .1997 IF YOU WANT A GOOD MATCH THAN SEE MANKIND VS KANE AND THE IC MATCH WITH OWEN HART VS STONE COLD STEVE AUSTIN.PS WWE SOULD MAKE MORE HISTORY MATCHS WITH WRESTLERS THAT YOU CAN NOT FIND LIKE BRET HART,MACHO MAN RANDY SAVAGE,THE ULTIMATE WARRIOR,RAZOR RAMON,STING,OWEN HART,PSYCHO SID,LEGION OF DOOM,THE STEINTER BROTHERS,THE NASTY BOYS,LEX LUGER,EARTHQUKE,THE OLD COFFIN DARK  UNDERTAKER.WWE plase.
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS

reviewText: 1997 Survivor SeriesNovember 9, 1997Molson CentreMontreal, Quebec, CanadaClassic Survivor Series Elimination Match:Headbangers & New Blackjacks V. New Age Outlaws & Godwinnsnot a very good opener. The match was slow and very underwhelming with the Outlaws surviving. *3/4Classic Survivor Series Elimination Match:D.O.A. V. Truth CommissionAnother match that wasn't good. It was more watchable than the first match. Kurrgan is the sole survivor. **Classic Survivor Series Match:Vader, Goldust, Marc Mero, & Steve BlackmanV.British Bulldog, JIm "The Anvil" Neidhart, Doug Furnas, & Phil LafonFinally, a good match. The crowd was into the way and the action was awesome. The Bulldog is the sole survivor. ***1/4Mankind V. KaneMick takes his hardcore bumps to show that Kane is a monster. Kane wins. ***Classic Survivor Series Elimination Match:Faarooq, The Rock, Kama, & D'lo-BrownV.Ken Shamrock, Ahmed Johnson, & Legion Of DoomThis match was horrible until the finish. Great work by Rocky & Shamrock and it helped the rating alot but the overall match was still pretty crappy. Shamrock is the sole survivor in this one. **1/4WWF Interocntinental Championship:Owen Hart (Champion) V. "Stone Cold" Steve AustinThis match sucked. It was like six minutes long and Austin only got the Lou Thesz (Rest In Peace) Press and a few punches and kicks in before hitting the Stunner to win the title. *1/2 However, Austin still have a very hurt neck at this point so I guess it's cool. I really don't think they wanted Austin to get hurt.WWF Championship:Bret Hart (Champion) V. Shawn MichaelsOk. Everyone knows what happened at the end of this match. Yes, Bret did indeed get screwed. However, people, I'm here to rate the matches and to give an honest opinion on the Pay-Per-View as a whole. and as for as I can see, this match was the Main Event. So I'm going to rate it just like I have rated everyone of my reviews (Which some of them I have to redo because I did them but memory and I wasn't writing anything down). So lets get started.The match started out as a brawl all over the Molson Centre. Then they finally get into the ring where some great wrestling and back and forth action takes place. Then the ref gets bumped and you all know the rest. Shawn puts Bret into the Sharpshooter and the ref calls for the bell. Shawn wins the WWF Championship. Bret flips outs and was never seen in the WWF again. The match itself was actually awesome except for the ending. So my rating of the match...**** Yes, it was a four star match. Maybe five if the real finish was put into place.Overall, not that good of a show but very well known for the Championship match and finish and Bret's last match in the WWF. On A Personal Note: I can't wait for the Bret Hart DVD to come out and everyone (Bret Hart Fan or Not) should pick it up. It's going to be awesome!
Title: WWF Survivor Series 1997 - Gang Rulz VHS
